abstract.p: Joseph J Saltarelli letter objects to tone of May 4 editorial on death of Cardinal John O'Connor

block.p: I was disappointed by your May 4 editorial about the death of Cardinal John O'Connor. You seemed to portray him more as a power broker while in my view minimizing the full scope of his accomplishments and compassion for the people of this city.
You disagreed with the cardinal on many issues -- for instance, on abortion and gay rights. The tone of your editorial betrayed your opposition to the views the cardinal held.

I was disappointed by your May 4 editorial about the death of Cardinal John O'Connor. You seemed to portray him more as a power broker while in my view minimizing the full scope of his accomplishments and compassion for the people of this city.
You disagreed with the cardinal on many issues -- for instance, on abortion and gay rights. The tone of your editorial betrayed your opposition to the views the cardinal held.

I had the honor of meeting Cardinal O'Connor once and admired him for the honesty and force with which he maintained his convictions, but mostly for his plain-spoken humanity. Like millions of others in New York and around the world, of many different faiths, I grieve his loss.
JOSEPH J. SALTARELLI New York, May 4, 2000
